body.p: Robert Martin states that he lives in the Town of Bennetsville and did at the time Margolyes kept his Tavern Near here I was there frequently and Margolyes Seemed at all times to endeavor to keep good order I have known of his buying corn and have seen corn there I never heard any complaint of food for man or horse. I have understood that he had engaged stabling of some of the near nieghbors. Given under my hand this 21st day of November 1861
Sworn to before me this 21st November 1861
Edward Pate J, P, B, C
